newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai baht eases, interbank rate lower late.
newsitem.headline: Thai baht eases, interbank rate lower late.

text.p: The Thai baht was slightly down against the dollar in late trade on Monday in line with the U.S. currency's movement up abroad, dealers said.
The baht was quoted at 26.057/26.067 to the dollar late compared with 26.050/26.053 in early morning.
"There was nothing exciting today. The baht/dollar trade was tracking the greenback's direction against the mark and yen," one dealer at a local bank.
The Bank of Thailand fixed the mid-rate at 26.06 per dollar against 26.08 on Friday.
The overnight interbank rate fell to 7.50 percent late from 8.00 in early morning and 7.75-8.00 late on Friday on some inflows of foreign funds, dealers said.
"There was some inflows of foreign funds. This helped raise money supply in the banking system," said one money market dealer.
Dealers said the central bank's reserve requirement due tommorow was unlikely to have much impact on the liquidity as most banks had already raised sufficient funds.
All commercial banks have to meet the Bank of Thailand's reserve requirement on seventh and 22nd of each month.
The one-month baht/dollar swap premium was quoted at 5.20/5.70 satangs per dollar late versus 5.00/6.00 in the morning.
